content:
• Monday, October 15, 2012
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) says that it may not have sufficient cash to fund operations and may need to...

    A123 Systems (AONE) says that it may not have sufficient cash to fund operations and may need to seek bankruptcy protection. The company failed to meet interest payments on approximately $143M of its material debt agreements today, and as a result, expects to be in default by tomorrow. Shares -47% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM | 11 Comments
  • GBDC

    Golub Capital BDC (NASDAQ:GBDC) slips after announcing a 2.6M share secondary offering . Wells...

    Golub Capital BDC (NASDAQ:GBDC) slips after announcing a 2.6M share secondary offering . Wells Fargo and UBS are acting as joint book-running managers for the offering, and the company intends to use the net proceeds to invest in portfolio companies in accordance with its investment objective and strategies, as well as for general corporate purposes. Shares -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • JOEZ

    More on Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q3 beats across the board on a 25% jump in total revenue, due...

    More on Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q3 beats across the board on a 25% jump in total revenue, due in large part to writedowns during the same prior year period. Net sales from retail +24% Y/Y, same store sales +7%, with contribution from 25 stores compared to 21 stores ove the prior year period. Gross margins increased to 71% from 67%. Shares +6.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q3 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $303.8M (+16.7% Y/Y)...

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q3 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $303.8M (+16.7% Y/Y) misses by $8M. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • MCEP

    Mid-Con Energy (NASDAQ:MCEP) announces a 4M unit offering , consisting of 1M common units...

    Mid-Con Energy (NASDAQ:MCEP) announces a 4M unit offering , consisting of 1M common units representing limited partner interests, plus an additional 3M units for Yorktown Energy Partners VI, Yorktown Energy Partners VII, and Yorktown Energy Partners VIII. RBC Capital Markets, Raymond James, UBS and Wells Fargo Securities are acting as joint book-running managers, with Baird, Oppenheimer and Stephens as co-managers for the offering. Shares -2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • MCHP

    Microchip (NASDAQ:MCHP) -3% AH after warning it expects to report FQ2 (Sep. quarter) revenue of...

    Microchip (NASDAQ:MCHP) -3% AH after warning it expects to report FQ2 (Sep. quarter) revenue of $407M-$408M, below a consensus of $420.3M. The microcontroller vendor, often seen as a bellwether for broader chip industry demand, blames "macroeconomic and industry conditions" in general. "The overall global economic outlook continues to be poor and is adversely impacting our business as well as the rest of the semiconductor industry." (also: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • DHCP

    Walter Investment Corp. (WAC) -8.8% AH following its announcement of a secondary offering of...

    Walter Investment Corp. (WAC) -8.8% AH following its announcement of a secondary offering of 4.5M shares along with $265m in convertible senior notes. The company intends to use about $95M of the proceeds to complete its acquisition of Reverse Mortgage Solutions. The rest of the money will create a war chest for future acquisitions in the servicing sector. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • RATE

    Bankrate (NYSE:RATE) -23% AH after announcing preliminary Q3 results with revenue expected at...

    Bankrate (NYSE:RATE) -23% AH after announcing preliminary Q3 results with revenue expected at $115.5M-$117.5M vs. consensus of $132.7M, and earnings of $0.11-$0.13 vs. consensus of $0.20. The results don't seem to square with what other reports say is very strong mortgage refinance activity. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • WDFC

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ4 misses consensus estimates across the board. The company blames...

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ4 misses consensus estimates across the board. The company blames the miss on lower sales in its harvest brand home care and cleaning products unit, plus higher input costs and adverse currency fluctuation. It also cuts its outlook for FY13, now expecting net sales of $356M to $370M, or $2.31 to $2.40 per share, versus Street expectations of $2.56 per share. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • HRS

    Shares of military contractor Harris Corp. (HRS -4%) slumped today after Lazard cut the stock to...

    Shares of military contractor Harris Corp. (HRS -4%) slumped today after Lazard cut the stock to Sell, citing a slowdown in orders and no material near-term catalysts to maintain or accelerate current share performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • JOEZ

    Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q3 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $30.3M (+25% Y/Y) beats by...

    Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q3 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $30.3M (+25% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +7.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDFC

    WD-40 Company (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ4 EPS of $0.56 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $84.9M (-6% Y/Y)...

    WD-40 Company (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ4 EPS of $0.56 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $84.9M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $9M. Shares -6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): Q3 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $81.4M (+6.5% Y/Y)...

    ICU Medical (NASDAQ:ICUI): Q3 EPS of $0.82 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $81.4M (+6.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CPGI

    Chinese paper-packaging maker China Shengda Packaging Group (CPGI +26.4%) jumps after saying...

    Chinese paper-packaging maker China Shengda Packaging Group (CPGI +26.4%) jumps after saying it's received an offer from Chairman Nengbin Fang to take the company private in a cash deal at $1.40 per share, valuing it at roughly $54.3M. Mr. Fang and his family currently own about 54% of the outstanding stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CUR

    Neuralstem (CUR +7.3%) pops after releasing positive results for its NSI-566 study, a spinal...

    Neuralstem (CUR +7.3%) pops after releasing positive results for its NSI-566 study, a spinal cord-derived neural stem cell line tested in a rat model of ischemic stroke. The data showed significant improvement in both motor and neurological tests, with the rats treated with the highest dose showing the most significant improvement in both categories.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK +3.1%) is rallying courtesy of an upgrade to Outperform from Wedbush: the firm...

    SanDisk (SNDK +3.1%) is rallying courtesy of an upgrade to Outperform from Wedbush: the firm cites a favorable NAND flash memory supply/demand balance (Goldman feels likewise) and strong OEM design wins (the iPhone 5 is among them).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO +1.5%) moves higher following a Reuters report it is looking to sell ~100K...

    Marathon Oil (MRO +1.5%) moves higher following a Reuters report it is looking to sell ~100K acres of undeveloped oil and gas properties in the Eagle Ford basin in south Texas. MRO owns ~325K total acres in the area.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +3.1%) trades higher ahead of tomorrow's Q3 report and an upgrade to...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +3.1%) trades higher ahead of tomorrow's Q3 report and an upgrade to Outperform by JPMorgan earlier today. The firm says that despite declines in domestic prostate-cancer surgeries there's compelling risk/reward in the shares, with meaningful opportunities emerging in other cancers and additional areas which, collectively, should more than offset the prostate-cancer softness and drive up Street estimates for the next several years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • TWI

    Titan International (TWI +5.3%) shares are sharply higher after Jefferies raises its rating to...

    Titan International (TWI +5.3%) shares are sharply higher after Jefferies raises its rating to Buy from Hold, seeing a favorable risk/reward profile following a recent pullback. The firm views a potential guidance update and more discussion of its Europe acquisition as potential catalysts for TWI; otherwise, it sees earnings and forecast risk in machinery stocks CAT, ETN and KMT.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • GILD

    Gilead (GILD -0.9%) slips a bit today after Bristol-Myers (BMY +3.2%) and Abbott (ABT +3.7%)...

    Gilead (GILD -0.9%) slips a bit today after Bristol-Myers (BMY +3.2%) and Abbott (ABT +3.7%) both reported favorable study results for their HCV drugs (I,II). Deutsche Bank defends the stock , saying the results of these studies show that utilizing different drug combinations yields more effective HCV treatments, and that this data actually bodes well for GILD's 7977-based class combos, for which it expects the drug developer to yield similar results.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • ABT

    Abbott (ABT +3.4%) moves up after initial results from its "Aviator" Phase 2b study of its...

    Abbott (ABT +3.4%) moves up after initial results from its "Aviator" Phase 2b study of its interferon-free, investigational regimen for the treatment of hepatitis C indicated that 99% of the "treatment naive" HCV patients - those who had never been previously treated for the virus - showed a sustained virological response. Additionally, 93% of patients in the study who had previously been unsuccessfully treated for HCV also showed sustained virological response.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • CYCC

    Midday top 10 gainers: CYCC +40%. BCOM +35%. IGLD +24%. YONG +16%. EQS +15%. DYAX +14%. ALN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CYCC +40%. BCOM +35%. IGLD +24%. YONG +16%. EQS +15%. DYAX +14%. ALN +13%. BSDM +11%. CLWR +11%. ESYS +9%.
    Top 10 Losers: OTC:DCTH -19%. PRWT -17%. DHRM -10%. AMED -9%. PLXT -9%. GROW -8%. IMOS -8%. OTC:HAUP -7%. ILMN -7%. DAC -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • PTNR

    Israeli carrier Partner Communications (PTNR +4.7%) rallies on news holding firm Scailex is in...

    Israeli carrier Partner Communications (PTNR +4.7%) rallies on news holding firm Scailex is in talks with media magnate Haim Saban about selling its stake in Partner: one report claims Saban will acquire a 35%-40% stake for $400M-$450M through a multi-stage deal. Rival Cellcom (CEL +5.3%) is also higher. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • CYCC

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC +40.4%) soars after saying that Phase II studies of it's lead...

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC +40.4%) soars after saying that Phase II studies of it's lead drug candidate Sapacitabine, a treatment for older patients with intermediate-2 or high-risk myelodysplastic syndrome, nearly doubled expected survival rates for elderly patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • VLO

    Valero (VLO -1.6%) extends last week's ~10% decline as it begins shutting several units for...

    Valero (VLO -1.6%) extends last week's ~10% decline as it begins shutting several units for planned maintenance, including a gasoline-making fluid catalytic cracking unit at its 156K bbl/day McKee refinery in Sunray, Tex.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • BMY

    Bristol-Myers (BMY +4.1%) jumps after late-breaking abstracts for The American Association for...

    Bristol-Myers (BMY +4.1%) jumps after late-breaking abstracts for The American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases annual meeting - of which BMY has a number of presentations on its Hep C virus studies - were posted to the organization's website this morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC -2.5%) falls on a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond James, whose checks...

    BMC Software (BMC -2.5%) falls on a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond James, whose checks indicate the systems management software vendor is facing operational and sales headwinds. BMC, which reports after the close on Oct. 31, has been struggling with sales issues for the non-mainframe portion of its business for some time.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • MU

    ChipMOS (IMOS -7.8%) plunges after reporting Q3 revenue of $175.5M (+6.4% Y/Y), and stating it...

    ChipMOS (IMOS -7.8%) plunges after reporting Q3 revenue of $175.5M (+6.4% Y/Y), and stating it expects Q4 revenue to be flat to -5% Q/Q. The chip packaging/testing services firm's Q4 revenue consensus stands at $179.4M. Soft DRAM packaging sales are said to be offsetting strong LCD driver and flash memory testing sales. The report could have negative implications for DRAM makers such as Micron (MU -0.1%). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (BAS -3.6%) says it received a subpoena from the SEC and believes it is...

    Basic Energy Services (BAS -3.6%) says it received a subpoena from the SEC and believes it is being investigated for potential violations of securities laws in connection with a July press release discussing June 2011 operating data.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +8.8%) trades up in reaction to a positive FDA staff report on...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +8.8%) trades up in reaction to a positive FDA staff report on its drug lomitapide. The drug treats a rare genetic disorder that causes very high cholesterol, and the report said that AEGR's plan to manage risk associated with it supports approval in adults with the most life-threatening forms. The drug is due to be reviewed on Wednesday by a committee of non-FDA medical experts, and the FDA will make a final decision by the end of December.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Pandora (P -2.7%) falls as details arrive about the long-rumored Xbox Music (NASDAQ:MSFT) a day...

    Pandora (P -2.7%) falls as details arrive about the long-rumored Xbox Music (NASDAQ:MSFT) a day ahead of its launch. The service bears a strong resemblance to Spotify: an ad-supported version that works on PCs and tablets will be free (it'll be Windows 8's default music service), while an ad-free version that supports the Xbox and smartphones will go for $10/month. However, iOS and Android apps won't arrive until next year. Pandora's Internet radio share thus far hasn't been hurt badly by growing competition. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • AU

    Talks break down between South Africa's top three gold producers and striking miners, failing to...

    Talks break down between South Africa's top three gold producers and striking miners, failing to reach agreement on pay proposals. Strikes have shut all seven of AngloGold's (AU -1.7%) South African mines, which account for about a third of its total production; two of Gold Fields' (GFI -1%) mines and one operated by Harmony (HMY -0.5%) also are closed.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 2 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday (WDAY +6.9%) rallies above $52, adding to Friday's huge post-IPO jump. While the...

    Workday (WDAY +6.9%) rallies above $52, adding to Friday's huge post-IPO jump. While the company's sky-high valuation fuels debate over whether a bubble has formed in high-growth enterprise/cloud software names, Workday execs have been touting the potential of its HR and ERP software to disrupt a global market of 23K+ enterprises with 1K or more employees - Workday's solutions are currently used by less than 400 of them. The company also says it's interested in expanding into analytics. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • LLY

    Leerink Swann ups Eli Lilly (LLY +5.3%) to Outperform and raises sales estimates on the back of...

    Leerink Swann ups Eli Lilly (LLY +5.3%) to Outperform and raises sales estimates on the back of positive trial results for its gastric cancer treatment, ramucirumab. The firm thinks the recently released data shows encouraging potential for use on other tumor types, which could boost sales and lower the drug's overall marketing risk outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -3.6%) slides after Jim Cramer advises against buying shares on M&A hopes....

    Fusion-io (FIO -3.6%) slides after Jim Cramer advises against buying shares on M&A hopes. The maker of high-end server flash memory subsystems reports after the close on Oct. 24.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • HZNP

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP +1.5%) ticks up after announcing that its SkyePharma unit has received a...

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP +1.5%) ticks up after announcing that its SkyePharma unit has received a Notice of Allowance from the USPTO for its application "Delayed Release Tablet with Defined Core Geometry" which covers Rayos, its previously approved pain reliever for patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • T

    AT&T (T -1.1%) and Verizon (VZ -1.1%) edge lower after Sprint (S +0.2%) and SoftBank...

    AT&T (T -1.1%) and Verizon (VZ -1.1%) edge lower after Sprint (S +0.2%) and SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) make their deal official - shares had already fallen a bit on Thursday following initial reports about the deal. In the PR announcing the acquisition, SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son bragged about his company's success in taking Japanese mobile share by "by introducing differentiated products to an incumbent-led market." SoftBank fell 4.9% in Tokyo today, adding to Friday's big losses. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • ASRT

    Depomed (DEPO +3.5%) pops after saying its New Drug Application for Serada was accepted for...

    Depomed (DEPO +3.5%) pops after saying its New Drug Application for Serada was accepted for filing by the FDA. In addition, the FDA has informed the company that the it's Reproductive Health Drugs Advisory Committee will also discuss the drug at an Advisory Committee meeting tentatively scheduled for March 4, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM -5.6%) dives after: 1) Pre-announcing Q3 revenue will be in a range of...

    Millennial Media (MM -5.6%) dives after: 1) Pre-announcing Q3 revenue will be in a range of $46.5M-$47M (above a $44.6M consensus), and net loss will amount to $1.9M-$2.5M. 2) Announcing a 10M-share stock offering. 1M shares will be new, and 9M will be sold by insiders. Millennial's lockup expiration recently ended.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM

  • Aug Business Inventories: +0.6% to $1,601.7B vs. +0.5% expected and +0.8% prior. Sales +0.5% to...

    Aug Business Inventories: +0.6% to $1,601.7B vs. +0.5% expected and +0.8% prior. Sales +0.5% to $1,246.6B. Inventory/sales ratio was 1.28.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • DCTH

    Delcath (OTC:DCTH) plummets 15.3% after saying that the FDA has accepted its Chemosat delivery...

    Delcath (OTC:DCTH) plummets 15.3% after saying that the FDA has accepted its Chemosat delivery system to treat a form of liver cancer for a standard review and not a priority one, as the company requested. That means that the agency has up to ten months to decide whether to approve the Chemosat system rather than six, as per a priority assessment. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • SRPT

    Phase IIb data that Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +2.9% to $27.88) presented over the weekend shows...

    Phase IIb data that Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +2.9% to $27.88) presented over the weekend shows that its eteplirsen treatment for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy is effective. Piper Jaffray says the drug has the potential for accelerated approval and reiterates its Overweight rating on Sarepta with a $38 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • S

    Some details about SoftBank/Sprint: 55% of existing Sprint (S +0.5%) shares will be purchased at...

    Some details about SoftBank/Sprint: 55% of existing Sprint (S +0.5%) shares will be purchased at $7.30/share for $12.1B. Another $8B will be spent to obtain Sprint shares (via new stock and a convertible bond) at $5.25 apiece. SoftBank will also get a warrant to buy 55M shares at $5.25. The deal is expected to close in mid-2013. Though Sprint isn't required to take any action regarding Clearwire (CLWR +20.3%), that $8B could facilitate a future deal, while allowing Sprint to pay down part of its $21B debt load. Dan Hesse will remain Sprint's CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 9 Comments
  • YONG

    Crop-nutrients maker Yongye International (NASDAQ:YONG) up 18.4% premarket on CEO Zishen Wu's...

    Crop-nutrients maker Yongye International (NASDAQ:YONG) up 18.4% premarket on CEO Zishen Wu's plans to take the company private at $6.60/share - a 38% premium to Friday's close that values the company at $334M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • EDU

    New Oriental Education (NYSE:EDU) fires off a 14.5% premarket gain after Oppenheimer takes its...

    New Oriental Education (NYSE:EDU) fires off a 14.5% premarket gain after Oppenheimer takes its rating on the name up to Outperform. Shares have now recovered more than half the ground lost since a SEC investigation and an attack from Muddy Waters drove them to single digits earlier in the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow EU shares nicely higher after encouraging trade and...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow EU shares nicely higher after encouraging trade and inflation data out of China and and better-than-expected retail sales in the U.S. The S&P benchmark is +0.6%. Sprint is +2.3% following confirmation that it's going Japanese, while Clearwire surges 15.95% even though it's not going to be part of the deal. Later : Business Inventories, Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • YONG

    Premarket gainers: YONG +15%. CLWR +14%. EDU +14%. AEGR +14%. CEL +9%. MTSL +8%. CTIC +8%. ISIS...

    Premarket gainers: YONG +15%. CLWR +14%. EDU +14%. AEGR +14%. CEL +9%. MTSL +8%. CTIC +8%. ISIS +7%.
    Losers: OTC:DCTH -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) +2.3% following a report it's in talks to sell its OMAP app...

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) +2.3% following a report it's in talks to sell its OMAP app processor business to Amazon. Such a deal would be a blow to Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), which has been seen as a beneficiary of TI's decision to retreat from the app processor market, and was once (inaccurately) rumored to have scored a design win for the second-gen Kindle Fire. But a TI/Amazon deal could clear the way for Nvidia's Tegra processor to be designed into future Barnes & Noble Nooks.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (NYSE:CNX) -2.7% premarket as it warns of a surprise loss in Q3, vs. expected EPS...

    Consol Energy (NYSE:CNX) -2.7% premarket as it warns of a surprise loss in Q3, vs. expected EPS of $0.35. The culprit is weak demand in thermal coal used for electricity: "While precise figures are not yet available, it is clear that the company's previously announced planned and unplanned mine idlings took their toll," says CFO William Lyons.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM
  • S

    Shares of Clearwire (CLWR) roar to a 9.5% gain premarket after Softbank's deal to take a...

    Shares of Clearwire (CLWR) roar to a 9.5% gain premarket after Softbank's deal to take a majority stake in Sprint could help it open the door to take a stab at its networking partner Clearwire.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU shares are solidly higher mid-morning trading following positive export and inflation data...

    EU shares are solidly higher mid-morning trading following positive export and inflation data out of China even though the latter's shares have fallen. Euro STOXX 50 +0.95%, London +0.3%, Paris +1%, Frankfurt +0.8%, Madrid +0.8%, Milan +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 AM
  • ERIC

    ZTE shares plunge 15.1% in Hong Kong after China's second-largest telecom-equipment maker warns...

    ZTE shares plunge 15.1% in Hong Kong after China's second-largest telecom-equipment maker warns that it will make a Q3 loss of up to 2B yuan ($319.1M). ZTE blames a delay in some overseas deals and a large number of low-margin contracts in Europe, Asia and the domestic market. U.S.-listed shares on watch include ALU (-1.7% in Paris), ERIC (-0.85% in Stockholm), CSCO, JNPR,CIEN, MMI, BBND. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed as positive Chinese data (I, II) fails to ease concerns about the...

    Asian shares are mixed as positive Chinese data (I, II) fails to ease concerns about the prospects for global growth. "These days there seems to be a lot of attention (paid) to one bad number and not a lot of attention (paid) to one good number," says BT Investment's Joe Bracken. Japan +0.5%, Hong Kong flat, China -0.5%, India -0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 AM
